intro: Bronwenia longipilifera, commonly known as the long-hair bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. Its leaves are leathery and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Bronwenia longipilifera thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
